Html:

Running on Win7 64 and everything is fine here. Dunno what could it be, but it's not windows itself.

Maybe something else, video drivers or modules or...

I suspect it has something to do with SQLLITE :(
We've tried it on more than 3 different Windows 7 64 bit PCs here....
the scrolling doesn't work...it's the only problem we're facing...

On form load,the map loads.
After the form loads,unable to view further when we scroll.
it works perfect on win7, i use it daily, are you sure you set target to x86?
i have uploaded the screenshots in Issue tracker.please have a look and let us know.
Yes,We have set the target to X86 and even tried removing the build conditions...it still doesn't work
what version?

I'm using Visual Studio 2010 in Windows 7 Professional 64 bit OS.

Thanks

Am using SQLite and GMaps without these issues.

Since you say you can't scroll, i'd look into the mouse events. Not GMaps' own, but your very mouse.

And i would also have a look at the layers if you're using WinForms, or zindex if you're using WPF.

Maybe you put some control over the GMap renderer???

WPF version works perfectly fine!!


Winforms version also works fine on X86 PC's here...
The problem ONLY occurs on 64 bit Operating Systems for Windows Forms Application....it does not occur on 32 bit OSs


Thanks
Ok so i have Gmaps WinForms working together with Win7 Home Premium 64, no problems at all.

Its not working in Windows 7 Professional 64 bit....


I guess the only option I have is to take a video and send you to prove it.... :-(

I believe you.

But the fact that Radioman and I (at least) have it working, means that it is not a general problem.

Must be something related to your specific configuration.
win7 ultimate works, win7 prof. works too, both x64, so it's not win7 version issue
